alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Randolph (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 5:41PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Delaware and west central Randolph Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Muncie, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Delaware and west central Randolph Counties, including the following locations... Farmland, Prairie Creek Reservoir, Ball State University, Parker City and Selma. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
